intro: Cyclocheilon somaliense, commonly known as the Somali cyclocheilon, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
